pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:0.5: 75. the training rule on defecating in water
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.2: the nuns from the group of six were defecating, urinating, and spitting in water.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.4: “How can nuns defecate, urinate, and spit in water? They are just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.5: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.6: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.7: “How can the nuns from the group of six defecate, urinate, and spit in water?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.9: who in turn told the Buddha.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.10: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.12: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.15: “How can the nuns from the group of six do this?
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.17: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.18.1: ‘I will not defecate, urinate, or spit in water,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.19: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the nuns.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.1: Soon afterwards, being afraid of wrongdoing, sick nuns did not defecate, urinate, or spit in water.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.2: They told the Buddha. He then had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.3: “Monks, I allow a sick nun to defecate, urinate, and spit in water.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.4: And so, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.5.1: ‘When not sick, I will not defecate, urinate, or spit in water,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.6: If one is not sick, one should not defecate, urinate, or spit in water.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.7: If, out of disrespect, a nun who is not sick defecates, urinates, or spits in water, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.13: if she does it on dry ground, but it then spreads to water;
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.17: if she is overwhelmed by pain;
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.18: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.19: The fifteenth training rule is finished.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.20: The seventh sub-chapter on shoes is finished.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.21: “Venerables, the rules to be trained in have been recited.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.22: In regard to this I ask you,
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.28: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I will remember it thus.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.29: The chapter on training is finished.
